## Tech stack

1. **R** ~ iPhone
2. **RStudio** ~ iOS
3. **Packages** ~ the apps





## R is more capable

- Almost always a better choice than Excel, SAS, SPSS 
- Incorporates new developments sooner, more flexibly
- General purpose language, not just data science
- Integrates well with other useful tools
    + Python
    + SQL
    + TensorFlow
    + Web (css, js)
    + LaTeX
    + MS Office


## R improves your quality of life

- Creates one workflow from data cleaning to presentation. No more messy files named <font class="cred">final.out</font>, <font class="cblue">FINAL.out</font>, <font class="cgreen">OMGFINAL.out</font>
- Ensures everything is current via piping
- Is (subjectively) easier to learn than SAS or SPSS syntax
- Handles tedium for you...


## 1 line of code {.flexbox .vcenter}

```{r echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=6, results="asis"}

plot_ly(economics, x = ~date, y = ~unemploy / pop)

```




## 3 lines of code

```{r echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=8, fig.height=3.75, results="asis"}

leaflet() %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addMarkers(lat=38.781366, lng=-77.013841, popup="We're here!")

```
